Lab 2: Awk/Python Scripting

Posted on January 26, 2015

Lab Submission instructions

Checkout your subversion directory:

svn co https://phoenixforge.cs.uchicago.edu/svn/cnetid-cs162-win-15

and create a directory for Lab 1

cd cnetid-cs162-win-15
mkdir lab1
svn add lab1     # make it a working copy
cd lab1
touch README     # README is now a working copy
svn add README

and then you can start working.

You get two 24-hour lab extensions this quarter, email me: [my last name] at cs dot uchicago dot edu for them. Make sure that you run

svn commit -m "update"

frequently as you work on the lab so that you will definitely have a submission come the midnight deadline. Late submissions are not accepted: the time-stamp counts. The code should be able to run without fault on the lab computers.

The README file

This should contain your name, a list of files you are submitting, and at least a sentence or two about each file.

Additionally make sure to add comments to your code explaining each of the procedures you use.

Lab text

This weeks lab can be downloaded here. There are associated lab files here. You can decompress the lab2 files using tar -xzvf lab2Files.tgz.
